question: A thick metal wire of density <katex>$\rho$</katex> and length 'L' is hung from a rigid support. The increase in length of the wire due to its own weight is (Y = Young's modulus of the material of the wire)
explanation: Elongation due to self-weight is <katex>$\Delta L = \frac{MgL}{2AY}$</katex>.
<katex>$\Delta L = \frac{(\rho A L) g L}{2AY} = \frac{\rho g L^2}{2Y}$</katex>.
